title.narrative: Humanitarian assistance through FAO to Somalia

description.narrative: Support a total of EUR 500 000 to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the UN FAO's humanitarian operations in Somalia. FAO contributes to food security and facilitates the livelihood recovery in crises. The humanitarian situation in Somalia remains on e of the world's most difficult. About 870 000 people live in a state of humanitarian emergency and is fully dependent on humanitarian assistance to meet their basic needs. The most vulnerable group is the country's 1.1 million internally displaced people. A total of 206 000 children under five are acutely malnourished 45 000 of them suffer from sever acute malnutrition. The improved food security situation has prompted the UN consolidated appeal to reduce the estimates for the required humanitarian assista nce for 2013 from 1.33 billion to 1.15 billion U.S. dollars. FAO's Somalia operation 2013 requires a total of 145 million U.S. dollars which in mid-October was only 37 % funded leaving a total funding gap of 91 million U.S. dollars. The aim of FAO's operat ions is to increase the food production capacity of vulnerable households e.g. by distributing seeds and fertilizers training of farmers supporting animal disease surveillance and monitoring.
